snippet: The Save American Workers Act would raise the threshold for full-time work — and eligibility for employer-sponsored health insurance — from 30 hours to 40 hours a week.
abstract: The Save American Workers Act would raise the threshold for full-time work — and eligibility for employer-sponsored health insurance — from 30 hours to 40 hours a week.

headline.main: Assessing One Possible Change to the Affordable Care Act
